summary: This is an email chain from August 2019 between a US Marshal Service Senior Inspector and FBI personnel discussing potential witnesses and information related to Jeffrey Epstein's activities on Little St. James island. The USMS inspector shares tips about former employees who may have information, references Epstein's travel with underage girls, and mentions a confirmed landing in Austria with three females. The correspondence occurs shortly after Epstein's death.

persons.name: Vanessa
persons.context: Worked on Jeffrey Epstein's property for a week; her fianc√© recently quit; she can help find more people who worked on the island.

persons.name: Anna
persons.context: Described by Vanessa as a female who 'knows all JEs secrets'.

persons.name: Kim
persons.context: Worked as an ATC in St. Thomas from March 2018 to April 2019; stated she saw Epstein with underage girls disembarking from his jet and flying to his island via helicopter.

persons.name: Pat
persons.context: ATC on St. Thomas who stated similar observations as Kim regarding Epstein and underage girls.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the investigation; his property, travel with underage girls, and death are discussed. He gave his pilots apartments and required NDAs from employees.

connections.description: Vanessa worked on Epstein's property for a week.
Anna is described as knowing all of Epstein's secrets.
Kim, as an ATC, witnessed Epstein with underage girls traveling to his island.
Pat, as an ATC, made similar observations regarding Epstein and underage girls.

events.title: Email correspondence about Epstein investigation
events.description: Email chain discussing potential witnesses, Epstein's travel, and plans for MLAT requests following Epstein's death.

events.title: Epstein's landing in Austria
events.description: Austria confirmed that Jeffrey Epstein landed with three females, had coffee at The Coffee House Landmann, and then departed.

events.title: Epstein's death
events.description: Referenced indirectly as 'then Saturday happened,' indicating Epstein's death on August 10, 2019, which impacted the investigation.

locations: Ashville, North Carolina (where Kim works for ATC)
The Coffee House Landmann (coffee shop in Austria)
keyFacts: Former employees and contractors on Epstein's island were bound by $1 million non-disclosure agreements (NDAs) and were previously 'petrified' to talk to authorities.
An Air Traffic Controller (Kim) witnessed Epstein disembarking from his jet with underage girls and transporting them via helicopter to his island between March 2018 and April 2019.
Austrian authorities confirmed Epstein landed there on March 22, 2019, with three females, visited a coffee shop, and departed.
The US Marshal Service was preparing Mutual Legal Assistance Treaty (MLAT) requests to identify individuals traveling with Epstein internationally at the time of his death.
Epstein provided apartments near the St. Thomas airport for his pilots under one of his company names.
